message_2:
To solve the inequality 3x + 2 > 8x - 10, we'll first isolate x on one side of the inequality.

Step 1: Subtract 3x from both sides of the inequality.
3x + 2 - 3x > 8x - 10 - 3x
2 > 5x - 10

Step 2: Add 10 to both sides of the inequality.
2 + 10 > 5x - 10 + 10
12 > 5x

Step 3: Divide both sides of the inequality by 5.
12/5 > 5x/5
12/5 > x

So, the solution to the inequality is x < 12/5.
